name: [C] Federal Salary Legislation
description:
Every hour, every member of the government gets a wage according to the index wage. The index wage is automatically adjusted based on inflation. Wages are paid out of different Government Accounts so the Government has to make sure to keep these stocked up. Owed wages are tracked.
Government members also receive a pension that is based on the index wage as well. The longer they serve, the more pension they receive. Pension payments are capped at 70% of the index wage.

PeopleToSendTo.contextDescription:
When triggered, the <ecoicon item="User">Citizen</ecoicon> value of the event will be used.

<ecoicon item="User">Citizen</ecoicon>: The citizen who performed the interaction.

properties.Title: Owed Wages Check
properties.UserDescription: Wages that are not paid out are remembered and citizens can check how much wages the government owes them with the !wagesowed chat command

properties.Message: The Government owes you this much wage:

properties.Title: Prime Minister Wage
properties.UserDescription: The Prime Minister receives 100% of the Index Wage. They get a fixed pension of 55% of the index wage when taking office.

properties.Title: Automatic Index Wage Adjustment
properties.UserDescription: Once per hour, the index wage is adjusted based on inflation.

properties.Title: Federal Civil Servant Wage
properties.UserDescription: Federal Civil Servants are long term employees (opposed to contractors) and receive 15% of the index wage and 1.75% of that per day as pension.
